item.title: The .50 Cal Opened Up on Me
item.description: A firsthand account of surviving a .50 caliber gun attack, detailing the incident, injuries, and the intense experience of combat situations.

media:content.media:title: The .50 Cal Opened Up on Me
media:content.media:description: A firsthand account of surviving a .50 caliber gun attack, detailing the incident, injuries, and the intense experience of combat situations.

item.title: One Mission, 12 Men, Zero Lost
item.description: A detailed account of a flawless military mission where 12 men completed their objective without casualties, highlighting planning, teamwork, and execution under pressure.

item.title: The .50 Cal Took a Chunk Out of Me
item.description: Hear the intense story of surviving a .50 caliber gun attack, detailing the injuries, combat experience, and how the situation unfolded.

item.title: A Conversation with Moonwalker Harrison Schmitt
item.description: Join a conversation with astronaut Harrison Schmitt, exploring his experiences on the Moon, scientific insights, and reflections on space exploration.

item.title: Korean War Veteran Shares Inchon Landing Story
item.description: Ralph Gastelum, a Korean War veteran with the 1st Marine Division, recounts the Inchon landing, liberating Seoul, and using a grenade in combat.

item.title: Sucked Out of a Plane Over the Battlefield
item.description: A harrowing firsthand account of being sucked out of a plane during combat, detailing survival, adrenaline, and the dangers faced over the battlefield.

item.title: Felix Rodriguez – Cuban Exile and CIA Agent
item.description: Learn about Felix Rodriguez, a Cuban native and exile who was recruited by the CIA, exploring his background, missions, and impact on covert operations.

item.title: We Lost Seven Men in 15 Seconds
item.description: A soldier recounts the intense moment when seven men were lost in just 15 seconds, highlighting the chaos, danger, and harsh realities of combat.

item.title: I Watched Napalm Kill Them by the Hundreds
item.description: A harrowing firsthand account of witnessing the devastating effects of napalm in combat, detailing the scale, intensity, and human cost of warfare.

item.title: He Shielded His Friend with His Body!
item.description: A heroic act of bravery where someone protected a friend using their own body, showcasing courage, quick thinking, and selflessness in a dangerous situation.

item.title: Vietnam Vet Clarence Singleton on NVA Tactics
item.description: Vietnam veteran Clarence Singleton explains the strategies and tactics used by the North Vietnamese Army, sharing firsthand insights from combat experiences.

item.title: I Grabbed My Knife and Went for His Throat
item.description: A tense firsthand wartime account describing a split-second decision in combat, capturing the fear, intensity, and survival instincts faced in life-or-death situations.

item.title: WWII Veteran Tom Rice on D-Day and Combat
item.description: WWII veteran Tom Rice, who fought 336 days across major battles and was wounded four times, recounts setting up a D-Day trap and his experiences from Normandy to Hitler’s Eagle’s Nest.

item.title: I Didn’t Realize the Bullet Hit Both Legs
item.description: A harrowing firsthand account of being shot, detailing the shock and challenges of surviving a bullet that passed through both legs during combat.

item.title: We Could Hear the Japanese Talking
item.description: A WWII veteran recalls an intense moment of combat, describing how close they were to enemy forces and the tension of hearing Japanese soldiers speak nearby.

item.title: The Real ‘Masters of the Air’
item.description: Exploring the true stories behind the “Masters of the Air,” highlighting the bravery, skill, and experiences of the airmen who shaped aerial combat history.

item.title: Gene Simmons Shares the Gift He Gave His Mom
item.description: Legendary rocker Gene Simmons reveals the special gift he gave his mother after KISS rose to fame, sharing a personal and heartfelt story from his journey to stardom.

item.title: I Peeked Over the Top and Saw the Muzzle Flash
item.description: A firsthand account of a combat moment, describing the intensity and danger of seeing a muzzle flash while peeking over cover during a firefight.

item.title: First Wave of Marines at Iwo Jima
item.description: A look at the first wave of Marines who landed on Iwo Jima, highlighting their courage, challenges faced, and the historic significance of this pivotal WWII battle.

item.title: Darrell Utt: Green Beret, Ranger, Sniper
item.description: Darrell Utt joined the Army in 1990, became a Green Beret, Ranger, and sniper, served in the Balkans, and led an elite special forces detachment in the Iraq War after 9/11.
